dubstep.solution.optimizer

Class PlanRewrite

  • java.lang.Object
    • dubstep.solution.optimizer.PlanRewrite

  • public abstract class PlanRewrite
extends java.lang.Object
    A tree visitor for Operators intended to rewrite subtrees. This class does nothing on its own. Subclasses override the apply() method, which transforms a Operator into a (hopefully) equivalent Operator. Apply is invoked exactly once on every node in the tree, and allows subclasses to replace the node with another.

    • Field Detail

      • defaultTopDown

        protected boolean defaultTopDown

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlanRewrite

        protected PlanRewrite(boolean defaultTopDown)
        Basic constructor. The one argument controls whether expressions are rewritten top-down or bottom-up. This is relevant for the correctness of certain rewrites. Top- down is required for things like selection, where one rewrite can set up another potential rewrite. For example: Select(Project(Join(A, B))) -> Project(Join(Select(A), B)) ... is actually two separate rewrites, applied top-down.
        Parameters:
        defaultTopDown - Set to true to rewrite nodes breadth-first (top-down), and false to visit depth-first (bottom-up).

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        protected abstract Operator apply(Operator node)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Override this method in subclasses. Apply receives a Operator, and returns an equivalent Operator that takes the place of its argument in the tree.
        Parameters:
        node - A plan node
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
